intro: Fontanesia philliraeoides var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fontanesia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for botanical gardens and specialized collections.
